questions.question: In the opening scene, the three witches say, “Fair is foul, foul is fair.” This means:

choices.answer: peace will follow the storm.
things will not be what they seem to be.
they will greet Banquo with fair tidings.
they will see to it that Duncan loses his life in battle.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the mood of Act I, scene i when the witches first appear?

choices.answer: confusion and distress.
horror and shock.
lighthearted wonder.
uneasiness and gloom.

questions.question: Macbeth is first presented to the audience as:

choices.answer: out of favor with the king.
Thane of Cawdor.
a brave and honored soldier.
jealous of Banquo.

questions.question: An example of dramatic irony in Act 1 occurs when:

choices.answer: the Thane of Cawdor is captured.
the second witch hails Macbeth as “Thane of Glamis.”
Macbeth questions why witches call him “Thane of Cawdor.”
the Thane of Cawdor is executed.

questions.question: Duncan is presented as someone who:

choices.answer: cannot judge people well.
cannot be trusted.
always thinks of money.
rules with an iron hand.

questions.question: Macbeth says of Duncan, "He's here in double trust..." meaning that Macbeth:

choices.answer: has no justifiable reason to kill the king.
will have to let fate take its course.
must take action now or give up becoming king.
is now free to assume the position of king.

questions.question: In Act 2, dramatic irony occurs when:

choices.answer: Macbeth sees daggers that seem to point him to murder.
Lady Macbeth smears blood on guards to make them look guilty
Macbeth hears after the murder,“Macbeth has murdered sleep.”
Macduff says it's bad for Lady M to hear about the murder.

questions.question: Another instance of dramatic irony in Act 2 occurs when:

choices.answer: king’s sons fail to join in to avenge the king’s murder.
king’s sons flee to avoid being murdered by their father.
Macduff believes the king’s sons are guilty of the murder.
Macbeth is made king instead of one of the king’s sons.

questions.question: Macbeth says, “Is this a dagger which I see before me..." From these lines, Macbeth:

choices.answer: questions what he sees due to the lack of good lighting.
is wavering in his decision to commit murder.
is hallucinating from anxiety of the impending murder.
B and C

questions.question: The voice calls out “Sleep no more! Macbeth does murder sleep” is symbolic of the idea that:

choices.answer: someone has witnessed Duncan’s murder.
Duncan will never awaken from his “sleep.”
Macbeth murdered Duncan while Duncan was asleep.
Macbeth will never again rest with a clear conscience.

questions.question: Which of the following quotations reveal Lady Macbeth’s feelings of guilt?

choices.answer: “Consider it not so deeply.”
“My hands are of your colour...wear a heart so white.”
“Had he not resembled my father as he slept, I had don’t.”
“If he do bleed...for it must seem their guilt.”

questions.question: “Upon my head they placed a fruitless crown.." In these lines, Macbeth realizes that:

choices.answer: the role of king is a triumph for him.
Lady Macbeth has just had a miscarriage.
the crown was made of brass and the jewels are fake.
he killed Duncan for Banquo’s benefit.

questions.question: “There the grown serpent lies; the worm that’s fled...will venom breed.” This means Macbeth is:

choices.answer: happy to learn that Fleance is wounded and cannot be harmed.
fearful that Fleance will prove a threat in the future.
fearful that Macduff will return to avenge  Banquo’s death.
hopeful that he will live his life untouched by fate.

questions.question: The most significant consequence of Fleance’s escape is that he can now:

choices.answer: avenge his father Banquo’s murder.
expose King Duncan’s murderer.
be a threat to Macbeth’s throne.
lend support to Duncan’s exiled sons.

questions.question: Hecate says Macbeth will “spurn fate, scorn death.. wisdom, grace, and fear.” Macbeth becomes:

choices.answer: victorious.
brave.
overconfident.
wise.

questions.question: “How say’st thou, that Macduff denies his person.." Macbeth orders Macduff’s murder family bc:

choices.answer: Macbeth has been ignored and insulted twice by Macduff.
The witches, Hecate in particular, instructed him to do so.
Macduff refused Lady Macbeth’s offer of hospitality.
Macbeth believes Macduff and his descendants are a threat.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a prophecy of the 3 apparitions the witches present to Macbeth?

choices.answer: Macbeth will remarry a woman who'll give birth to his heir.
Macbeth should beware Macduff.
No person born from a woman shall harm Macbeth.
Macbeth will only be harmed when forest comes to his castle.

questions.question: When the witches show Macbeth the vision of 8 kings, what frightens Macbeth about what he sees?

choices.answer: He realizes that the witches tell the truth.
He realizes that he will have no heir to the throne.
He realizes he wronged his friend Banquo.
He realizes throne unsafe & Banquo’s heirs will be kings.

questions.question: Malcolm tells Macduff that when he is king, he will do some nasty things. This information:

choices.answer: foreshadows that Malcolm will be a tyrannical king.
is a lure for Malcolm to test Macduff’s noble character.
is what Macbeth told Malcolm to say
attracts Macduff and aligns him even more so to Malcolm.

questions.question: When Macduff asks Ross about his family, he says “they were all at peace" This is an example of

choices.answer: tragedy.
sarcasm.
melodrama.
equivocation.

questions.question: “More needs she the divine than the physician.” The doctor thinks Lady M needs help from a:

choices.answer: a priest’s guidance.
strong medications.
talk therapy and psychoanalysis.
a vacation.

questions.question: “I have almost forgot the taste of fears" When Macbeth hears wife is dead, he recognizes that:

choices.answer: he has seen too much slaughter to react with emotion.
he no longer loves Lady Macbeth.
he is glad to hear that she is dying.
he realizes that he has been tricked by the witches.

questions.question: “Life’s but a walking shadow, a poor player.." What do the lines reveal about Macbeth?

choices.answer: His desire for redemption.
His deep love for his wife.
His sense that life is meaningless.
His regret for losing power.

questions.question: In the final battle, on whose side are Lennox, Angus, Menteith and Caithness?

choices.answer: the rebel Scots, led by Macduff and Malcolm.
the Scots loyal to Macbeth, led by him as king.
the English army, led by King Edward the Confessor.
the Norwegians, led by King Erik Bluetooth.

questions.question: Young Siward dies with honor at Macbeth’s hands because:

choices.answer: he fights without a sword.
he fights with damaged armor.
Macbeth fights him unfairly and dishonorably.
Young Siward stands up to Macbeth and does not run.

questions.question: As he preps final battle, Macbeth expresses his disappointment that old age will not bring him:

choices.answer: his legacy of children and heirs.
love, honor, and many friends.
a faithful, honest wife who is ambitious.
a contented retirement.

questions.question: "Lay on, Macduff..damned be him that first cries ‘Hold, enough!’” MacB fights to death because?

choices.answer: is given no other choice.
thinks that Macduff can be easily defeated.
does not believe Macduff’s claim about his birth.
prefers an honorable defeat to a humiliating surrender.

questions.question: Macbeth’s tragic flaw is....

choices.answer: Desire for glory.
Ambition.
Patience and understanding.
Loyalty to fate.

questions.question: How are Macbeth and Banquo considered character foils in the play?

choices.answer: Begin the play as heroes, and they both die as heroes.
Begin as heroes, hear futures, but react differently
Begin w/futures foretold but MacB don't trust it, BanQ does.
Begin hearing futures foretold, only MacB’s prophecies true.

questions.question: Which of the following is a sign of Macbeth’s guilt in the play?

choices.answer: He sees ghost of Duncan sitting in his chair at the banquet.
He sees a bloody chair floating around his head.
He refuses to take bloody daggers back to murder scene.
He orders the slaughter of Lennox’s entire household.

questions.question: Who acts as the play's comic relief?

choices.answer: Lennox
Doctor
Jester
Porter

questions.question: Lady Macbeth characterizes her husband as being

choices.answer: "the glass of fashion and the mould of form."
"too full of the milk of human kindness."
"a cannon overcharg'd with a double crack."
"he tries way too hard to be nice, it's creepy"

questions.question: Birnam Wood comes to Dunsinane when...

choices.answer: the witches rendezvous with Macbeth
the woods are set aflame
the camouflaged soldiers make their advance.
Malcolm rides in on horseback

questions.question: According to evidence in Act V, Lady Macbeth died

choices.answer: at the hands of assassins
of a physical ailment
by being poisoned by Macbeth
by her own hand

questions.question: Which of these predictions come true in the end?

choices.answer: “None of woman born shall harm Macbeth.”
“Beware the Thane of Fife.”
“Macbeth shall never be conquered..Birnam comes to Dunsinane
All of the above
